reviewText:
Product received for free

Don't recommend to play this game. It may be funny at the beginning, but later you will need much resources to upgrade your stuff. No problem, if there wouldn't be a player, who raid your base over and over, so you can't collect the things you need. Asked the developers for help or at least some kind of support, but all I got was a short E-Mail, that this fact (the same player can raid you multiple times even that your own base normaly should disappear from his map after he raided you) is a normal and random thing. Sure, it is completly random, he raid me at leats one time a day. Looks more like a hack or cheat or bug to me. *irony on* But the developers must be right and it is random. *irony off*

Better uninstall this game than playing.

reviewText:
Honestly a fun game until you get to the point of COMPLETE STANDSTILL. This is when your unable to capture any islands or progress into the game because it simply gets too hard. It has nothing at all to do with skill when groups of turrets are killing your entire army in less than 10 seconds. How to get out of this standstill? Spend a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ing month saving up money and upgrading your boats and soldiers, JUST TO BARLEY WIN THE BATTLE ANYWAY.

Every single thing in this game requires large amounts of patients, money, and other materials. Most of the time it doesnt make sense anyway.. For example: 5000 wood to upgrade a building, then pretty much double that to upgrade it again? What part of that makes any sense? I know its just a game but honestly why do I need to spend a day saving up wood just for it all to be drained instantly for such a stupid outcome? And what about the enourmous amounts of money it takes to upgrade your army? One of the first upgrades in the game is 10k for like 10 extra damage per second...? I honestly thought this was a glitch or I was reading it wrong.

I dont mind waiting games like these but I do mind having to waste hours to days to weeks to MONTHS for the stupidest outcome. Maybe if there was a way to shorten upgrade time somehow?(Not going to bother wasting money on diamonds) Or maybe keep the amount of materials it takes to upgrade something. Honestly a fun game and im going to keep playing it for awhile but the creators are clearly horrible at making games..

reviewText:
Almost everything about this game is amazing.
I simply immerse from the sound effects it's like im there fighting with the troops hearing the gun fires from left and right feeling their pain when they die. Never have i seen such responsive controls with such precision.
The graphics? Pure beauty.
Peace fills my heart when i stare at my beautiful island listening to the waves and looking at the beautiful green trees and flora.
The animations? While they are not perfect but then again what is perfect? nothing is perfect in this world.
Perfection is that illusion we seek in life but can never find because it's just that an illusion a lie.
I can truly see greatness in this game's future.

reviewText:
This game is currently rough around the edges, but still plenty of fun.  This is a great concept and very enjoyable as a semi-casual game...enough strategy to not be dull.

I'm listing the negatives here in the hopes that the developers will take them into consideration.  I wouldn't be taking the time to list these if I didn't think this game was promising!

- English translations are horrible
- Progression is jerky.  At some points, I was leveling up quickly, storming tons of beaches, and having a blast.  At other times, there were no islands I could take and I was left twiddling my thumbs waiting for resources to trickle in.
- During battles, the mouse is used for two things.  Scrolling the map (via click and drag), and placing markers to guide your troops and bombard targets.  These are currently all done with the left mouse button, which causes unintended actions.  This can easily lead to battles being lost that would have been won.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND that the developers map the left mouse button to actions and the right mouse button to map scrolling!

Polish this up a bit more and this will be a terrific game!  You're already well on your way!

reviewText: I have noticed that this game is very similar to Boom Beach, and frankly I love it.  Sure the graphics are not as polished as the Tablet/Mobile versions of these types of games.  But it's a free game and I can play it on my pc, with my 32 inch Monitor.   Less straining on the eyes, and the lack of a touch interface is a godsend.   Good old keyboard and mouse.  Old school gaming at its finest.\n\nKeep up the good work Devs :)

reviewText: While I have to agree with most others and say that this is a copy if boom beach, it is simply a version for PC. Thats what people dont realize. If you want ot stick to playing on your phones and ipads and what not, be my guest, but this is a good game. I tend to like these kind of games because it is kind of open world but you still have to upgrade stuff. Some people may agree with me on this but if you dont, thats your problem and your opinion. I felt like i needed to make this reveiw so that some people could see a good reveiw so the creators could get more downloads. This is a GOOD GAME for people who like little simple games like this. But i still agree with a lot of people in saying that it is a basic copy of Boom Beach.

reviewText:
Before I start.
If you like facebook/mobile base building games then your'll probably get enjoyment from this game
If you don't then this isnt going to be a game for you.


War of Beach is pretty much what you expect from games that you find on facebook or on one of the mobile app stores.

The basic gameplay works and if you like those kind of games then your'll get enjoyment out of this. For the most part connection to the server is good and loading is quick enough.

The downside to the game is that because the developers are not native english speakers the translation is not great. Dont get me wrong its possible to understand the intention but its a bit like reading text that has been put through google translate. Of course this will no doubt get fixed and although a bit annoying not game breaking.
